commit_message:
Migrate charm charmhub for stable/victoria

- start from stable/victoria branch
- Do charmcraft, osci, zuul changes
- Modify libs to point to stable/victoria for:
  - charmhelpers
  - charms.openstack (as needed)
  - zaza & zaza.openstack.tests
- Remove unsupported test bundles
- migration bundles to charmhub.io (ch: prefix + channels)
- Build on 20.04 amd64
- Run on 20.04 amd64, s390x, ppc64el, arm64
- Pin tempest for python<3.8
- Replace mysql-* 8.0.19 tracks with 8.0

Change-Id: Ifdf55b24c61548be49707a320727b7d212a21d69

[{'created': '2022-06-21 18:34:35.000000000', 'message': 'Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades

commit_message:
Charmhub migration for stable/train (bionic-only)

This is the main patch for the migration of the stable/21.10
charm to charmhub for the stable/train branch (train track on
charmhub).  This patch initially supports bionic from queens
to train, and does not support ussuri.  It supports upgrades
from bionic-queens to bionic-train (with each intermediate
step needed).  Crucially it does NOT set a default
openstack-origin, which means installing train/stable
without specifying the openstack-origin will result in a
bionic-queens installation.  This is intentional as the branch
covers queens to train.

Change-Id: Id37b7345a97913c20e3818712dee72405311b237

commit_message:
Do not end ceph_namespace with a slash

The parse_container_image_prepare utility function
incorrectly appends a slash to the ceph_namespace tag
it extracts from the container image prepare file. Use
not '/'.join but os.path.normpath of os.path.join.

Change-Id: I47e55b33ae70e1a6de141bf96c0080b730dc2966
Closes-Bug: #1979554
(cherry picked from commit c9218859a2611923f809cd7650db26370f421019)

commit_message:
Support mariabackup as a galera SST method

In addition to rsync and rsync tunnelled over socat,
expose the ability to use mariabackup in galera config.

Related-Bug: #1973872

Change-Id: I4d5983ada52a58cdd853bd7b701bb11eeb88be8d

commit_message:
Fix inconsistent spec file name

A spec files should be named following name of the puppet class it
tests. This change fixes the wrong spec file name which tests
the octavia::provider::ovn class. Its current name assumes the spec
file tests the octavia::ovn::provider class.

Change-Id: I0e5728208c8ea62a73b10b555ca409aabf0142af
(cherry picked from commit a9a19950abac63eaf2ffcc169257ca245fd2c560)
(cherry picked from commit e0369252deba67b4ff3c7cda634bdf111f060426)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-13 21:37:19.000000000', 'message': 'ovn-migration: Remove second tripleo-update call

The second tripleo-update call was there only to update hiera data on
the nodes. However the action did the whole deploy for all nodes in the
environment, which can take hours to finish. This patch fetches
currently configured integration bridge on the nodes and later updates
just the hieara data.

It also fixes potential problem that can occur if operator configures
OVNIntegrationBridge to other than br-int value. The migration used to
have br-int hardcoded.

Change-Id: I7455852898bb6e9698ecf5261d4401bc5077c506
'}, {'created': '2022-06-23 19:18:12.000000000', 'message': "ovn-migration: Remove second tripleo-update call

The second tripleo-update call was there only to update back integration
bridge variable. However the action did the whole deploy for all nodes
in the environment, which can take hours to finish. This patch relies on
other patch in THT that sets br-int as default value. This way once
ovn-extras.yml is not used and the integration bridge is not overriden,
we no longer need to update tripleo about the value so it's safe to
remove the second call.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/847402
Change-Id: I7455852898bb6e9698ecf5261d4401bc5077c506
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ovn-migration: Remove second tripleo-update call

The second tripleo-update call was there only to update back integration
bridge variable. However the action did the whole deploy for all nodes
in the environment, which can take hours to finish. This patch relies on
other patch in THT that sets br-int as default value. This way once
ovn-extras.yml is not used and the integration bridge is not overriden,
we no longer need to update tripleo about the value so it's safe to
remove the second call.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/847402
Change-Id: I7455852898bb6e9698ecf5261d4401bc5077c506
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Set zuul post-timeout to 3 hours

This is completely excessive but part of debugging why there is occasional
POST_TIMEOUT jobs failures when uploading logs to swift storage.

Change-Id: I070284b8c35cdaa098a28c052995ebf5c3f4250c

commit_message:
Disable deprecation warning for tenant_id

Neutron clients are still refering to tenant_id in very many places and
the warning become very intruisive. Disable them untill we ourselves get
rid of those usages in OSC and other similar places.

Change-Id: Iaf5b467cf42a53b60e14085b0c0cb86d9ede3310

commit_message:
Quote single parameter string

Quotes around paramerer string because apt-add-repository requires
single parameter but networking-tools-source can contain multiple word entries.

Closes-Bug: #1980020

commit_message:
Make instance_uuid optional in attachment create

Cinder and cinderclient assumes an attachment create request will
always contain instance_uuid. This is not true when glance calls
cinder for attachment in glance cinder configuration.
This patch (along with the cinder patch) make the instance_uuid
optional and allow glance to do attachments without passing
instance_uuid.

Change-Id: Ifbaca4aa87d890bc5130069638d42665b914b378

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-28 10:06:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix unbound router_id variable while creating event

If there was any SDK exception while adding Subnet to the Router
e.g. 504 Gateway Time-out, no router_id would be returned causing
the Kuryr controller to restart when trying to create an event with
the unbound variable router_id. This commit fixes the issue by
removing the variable.

Change-Id: Ib26fce6ccdc83c61821b54297a388d0acd2da2c7
'}]
commit_message:
Fix unbound router_id variable while creating event

If there was any SDK exception while adding Subnet to the Router
e.g. 504 Gateway Time-out, no router_id would be returned causing
the Kuryr controller to restart when trying to create an event with
the unbound variable router_id. This commit fixes the issue by
removing the variable.

Change-Id: Ib26fce6ccdc83c61821b54297a388d0acd2da2c7

commit_message:
Partially revert "Do not link up HA router gateway in backup node"

This partially reverts commit c52029c39aa824a67095fbbf9e59eff769d92587.

We revert everything except one minor addition to
neutron/agent/l3/ha_router.py which ensures that ha_confs path is
created when the keepalived manager is initialised.

Closes-Bug: #1965297
Change-Id: I14ad015c4344b32f7210c924902dac4e6ad1ae88
(cherry picked from commit 36bf1df46df4de8f9ed0c19e1118480ce2e55d8a)
(cherry picked from commit 7cf7ae05659b363e54fbb04d2c02f91b17763921)
(cherry picked from commit 22f231fd8b2e145e63753712406ddbad01d0d08a)

commit_message:
Nova: Remove non-existing methods from fake class

The following three methods don't exist in manila.compute.nova.API
while these are present in manila.network.neutron.api.API .
 - security_group_create
 - security_group_list
 - security_group_rule_create

This change removes these interfaces from the fake class to detect
usage of non-existing api in unit tests properly.

Change-Id: I3b8a13d0d5334004a54a03e9d4f32e1bd9cb57fa

commit_message:
Add config option reserved_share_extend_percentage

'reserved_share_extend_percentage' backend config option allows Manila
to consider different reservation percentage for share extend
operation. With this option, under existing limit of
'reserved_share_percentage', we do not want user to create new share if
limit is hit, but allow user to extend existing share.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1961087
Change-Id: I000a7f530569ff80495b1df62a91981dc5865023

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-20 10:46:05.000000000', 'message': 'Ignore unreachable errors for scale playbook

We need to continue with scale tasks if some nodes are
unreachable. Looks like ansible returns "Return Code: 4" [1]
for unreachable nodes, let's ignore that.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/executor/task_queue_manager.py#L103

Change-Id: Iea2022bf8dd27eb8762158c04cd3e0186da4fe0c
(cherry picked from commit d116a5afada7c99ca6d076fab61560e68b5e5b16)
'}]
commit_message:
Ignore unreachable errors for scale playbook

We need to continue with scale tasks if some nodes are
unreachable. Looks like ansible returns "Return Code: 4" [1]
for unreachable nodes, let's ignore that.

[1] https://github.com/ansible/ansible/blob/devel/lib/ansible/executor/task_queue_manager.py#L103

Change-Id: Iea2022bf8dd27eb8762158c04cd3e0186da4fe0c
(cherry picked from commit d116a5afada7c99ca6d076fab61560e68b5e5b16)

commit_message:
Fix some trivial typos in puppet code

This change fixes some typos in puppet code (apart from
parameter descriptions and/or comments) which might affect
module functionality.

Conflicts:
      manifests/quota/sfc.pp

Resolved conflicts by removing manifests/quota/sfc.pp module
contents, as it was not there in previous releases.

Change-Id: I3f310ee89b99078582b174c2c288a53cac47e5ed
(cherry picked from commit bd55507a5ba307913cc57071903c893d431ca9af)

subject: Accept array or hash for enable_provider_drivers
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-06-25 12:20:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2022-06-27 15:29:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2022-06-28 10:48:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-25 12:20:35.000000000', 'message': 'Accept array or hash for enable_provider_drivers

The [api_settings] enable_provider_drivers parameter is DictOpt and
accepts a string value which represents a dictionary. This change
allows using array or hash for this parameter so that users can use
a more "native" type to define its value.

Change-Id: Icfa01a6cba5f4eda68d51ec2740f24fbc049f6e2
(cherry picked from commit 270d33d5436b0e9f13f88b308a17e299e00f21bc)
'}]
commit_message:
Accept array or hash for enable_provider_drivers

The [api_settings] enable_provider_drivers parameter is DictOpt and
accepts a string value which represents a dictionary. This change
allows using array or hash for this parameter so that users can use
a more "native" type to define its value.

Change-Id: Icfa01a6cba5f4eda68d51ec2740f24fbc049f6e2
(cherry picked from commit 270d33d5436b0e9f13f88b308a17e299e00f21bc)

commit_message:
Accept array or hash for enable_provider_drivers

The [api_settings] enable_provider_drivers parameter is DictOpt and
accepts a string value which represents a dictionary. This change
allows using array or hash for this parameter so that users can use
a more "native" type to define its value.

Change-Id: Icfa01a6cba5f4eda68d51ec2740f24fbc049f6e2
(cherry picked from commit 270d33d5436b0e9f13f88b308a17e299e00f21bc)
(cherry picked from commit 8da4abe08def306e2f3669f5aa2dbfb8d1d69459)

commit_message:
Refactor unit tests of ironic::pxe

This refactors unit tests of the ironic::pxe class according to
the following points.

- Chainload image resource should be tested with default parameters

- Make sure package resources are included

- The resource title for syslinux-tftpboot package is syslinux, instead
  of syslinux-tftpboot.

- 'default_params' and 'p' are not used

Change-Id: Ibb1d9b232303c536019e95fc17b3619c791553d4
(cherry picked from commit aab3ad2630034e0478aefc23588166b7678eb077)

[{'created': '2022-03-10 15:16:00.000000000', 'message': "Deprecate the etcd3 driver

The etcd3 driver depends on the python-etcd3 [1]
library that is currently stale and no has no
active maintenance [2] with a non-working CI
that blocks all PRs.

It's also currently blocking Tooz from supporting
newer versions of tenacity [3]\xa0that a lot of
projects is now pinning because newer version of
tenacity dropped old legacy compatibility code
that has been in there for years.

We currently have etcd3gw as an alternative driver
where the library the driver depends on is a
deliverable that we maintain.

[1] https://github.com/kragniz/python-etcd3
[2] https://github.com/kragniz/python-etcd3/issues/1719
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tooz/+/829412

commit_message:
Deprecate the etcd3 driver

The etcd3 driver depends on the python-etcd3 [1]
library that is currently stale and no has no
active maintenance [2] with a non-working CI
that blocks all PRs.

It's also currently blocking Tooz from supporting
newer versions of tenacity [3]Â that a lot of
projects is now pinning because newer version of
tenacity dropped old legacy compatibility code
that has been in there for years.

We currently have etcd3gw as an alternative driver
where the library the driver depends on is a
deliverable that we maintain.

[1] https://github.com/kragniz/python-etcd3
[2] https://github.com/kragniz/python-etcd3/issues/1719
[3] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tooz/+/829412

Change-Id: Iff0cd3b51cfc45ecbddc831c55267e80e9c79cac

commit_message:
Fix swift pollsters that use get_account

this is a followup to I38f9ff2bec0a2a3cb9dfc5c362284e33c12f3127

in swiftclient, head_account and get_account have somewhat different
signatures, specifically order of kwargs. While passing http_conn as
third arg works for head_account, it does not work for get_account.
In order for it to work for both, it must be passed as kwarg.

Change-Id: I5433dc248e3f02c67107466408ed8c9ea8dd16a7

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 34936, 'date': '2022-06-21 12:34:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2022-06-28 08:24:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-14 15:15:07.000000000', 'message': 'dell: Fix VLAN creation on OS9 devices

The VLAN name on Dell OS9 devices cannot begin with a number.  The
"ngs_network_name_format" option is supposed to solve this problem by
adding a custom prefix in front of the network UUID.  However, VLAN names
on OS9 are also limited to 32 characters, which is the length of the UUID.
As such, it is not possible to add a prefix.

To solve this issue, simply set the VLAN description and leave the name
empty.

Change-Id: Id990c9431c54b60584a33eedef46d42257a27ce0
'}]
commit_message:
dell: Fix VLAN creation on OS9 devices

The VLAN name on Dell OS9 devices cannot begin with a number.  The
"ngs_network_name_format" option is supposed to solve this problem by
adding a custom prefix in front of the network UUID.  However, VLAN names
on OS9 are also limited to 32 characters, which is the length of the UUID.
As such, it is not possible to add a prefix.

To solve this issue, simply set the VLAN description and leave the name
empty.

Change-Id: Id990c9431c54b60584a33eedef46d42257a27ce0

commit_message:
Render all_nodes_data in check mode

We used to render all nodes data in check mode on each node.
However, after Ic10858ce7eaa5353d546e75b26e7149df2e1aa2a we
copy it from the control node, which is not generated in
check mode. Let's generate it on control node in check mode.

Resolves: rhbz#2096427
Change-Id: If4945d4b50262ef3adf1cd555e51039a98cdc433

commit_message:
Skip test_quota_network_set_with_force func test

This test was added in [0] and it causes a lot of failures, since
setting the network quota to 1 will result in quota errors for any other
test that is trying to create a network in parallel. We can only run
this test in a serial tempest task that would need to be created for
such a scenario.

Related-Story: 2010110
Change-Id: I6015c181ecabff26bdb1b0c11b0e33ad39e6f083

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-23 18:52:17.000000000', 'message': 'Neutron: Set br-int as default integration bridge

Having the default set is useful for migration from Neutron OVS
mechanism driver to the OVN mechanism driver. The migration process
installs OVN configured with temporary br-migration bridge. To avoid
problems with potential future updates we had to call "overcloud deploy"
twice, second time just to re-deploy all things again with br-int. We
can avoid the second call and speed up the migration process
significantly just by setting the default in THT.

Change-Id: Iedad3472383aec6708af41edfaf400879a5a0d26
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Neutron: Set br-int as default integration bridge

Having the default set is useful for migration from Neutron OVS
mechanism driver to the OVN mechanism driver. The migration process
installs OVN configured with temporary br-migration bridge. To avoid
problems with potential future updates we had to call "overcloud deploy"
twice, second time just to re-deploy all things again with br-int. We
can avoid the second call and speed up the migration process
significantly just by setting the default in THT.

Change-Id: Iedad3472383aec6708af41edfaf400879a5a0d26
Signed-off-by: Jakub Libosvar <libosvar@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2022-06-24 08:05:50.000000000', 'message': 'Support setting Nova API microversion for openstack-exporter

Starting from v1.5.0 of the exporter, OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION can be set
to configure the Nova API version to be used [1]. Microversion 2.1 can
be used to keep metrics unmodified from the previous exporter version
deployed by Kolla (v1.3.0).

Support it with prometheus_openstack_exporter_compute_api_version,
defaulting to using version 2.1 to keep metrics unchanged.

(cherry picked from commit 41fba3c5df8880a899ddee2e47218c0eab1778b7)
'}]
commit_message:
Support setting Nova API microversion for openstack-exporter

Starting from v1.5.0 of the exporter, OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION can be set
to configure the Nova API version to be used [1]. Microversion 2.1 can
be used to keep metrics unmodified from the previous exporter version
deployed by Kolla (v1.3.0).

Support it with prometheus_openstack_exporter_compute_api_version,
defaulting to using version 2.1 to keep metrics unchanged.

[1] https://github.com/openstack-exporter/openstack-exporter/pull/201

Change-Id: I7605a3f9f74effb29ecec3b28e4709fd5f7f8cd4
(cherry picked from commit 41fba3c5df8880a899ddee2e47218c0eab1778b7)

commit_message:
Do not send full_listing=True to swift client

When sending "full_listing=True" to swiftclient.client.Connection.get_account
or to swiftclient.client.Connection.get_container, the "limit" parameter does
not work. It needs to be set to False.

Closes-Bug: #1724598
Change-Id: Id483292ed529e70e762b21c459fb412c5aaad074

commit_message:
Adjust ceph minor update section

From wallaby+ Ceph is deployed by cephadm and minor updates
are considered day2 operations that can be performed using the
cephadm cli [1].
This patch adjusts current automation from the tripleo-upgrade
project for ceph update related tasks.

`overcloud external-update run --tags ceph` command is replaced with cephadm.
The 'ceph' tags were removed from tht[2] and ceph update can't be run with
TripleO commands. Cephadm should be used instead to safely upgrade Ceph
from one release to the next.

[1] https://docs.ceph.com/en/pacific/cephadm/upgrade/#starting-the-upgrade
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates/+/830051
Change-Id: I5fe5c10b9f997b12cb87a24cbf00a48f2f6cca8c

Change-Id: Idf8ce157c54b09a544925d5fbb2c388eea47aff6

commit_message:
Set the RUNNING task status to FAILED as worker service suspended

Create a mapping between task and worker. When the worker node is
offline or suspended, set the RUNNING task on the worker node to the
failed state, So that the engine can Revert or Retry the task

Closes-Bug: #1922623
Change-Id: I1fc378a38b4f15f5e2eafba51893e5878dfe8dd6

[{'created': '2021-03-08 17:47:22.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] fix lm with libvirt >= 7.0.0?

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-03-08 18:33:04.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper".

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.


Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-03-09 08:14:42.000000000', 'message': 'Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[2][3] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2021-03-09 12:42:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix live-migration with libvirt >= 6.8.0

libvirt 6.8.0 introduces virt-ssh-helper which prepends the libvirt
ssh command with a "which virt-ssh-helper". libvirt used to first
check for `nc` (netcat). But these two libvirt commits[1][2] have now
changed it to first look for `virt-ssh-helper`, if it not available,
then fall back to `nc`.

The nova-migration-wrapper doesn't accept this command and denies
the connection.

Until nova-migration-wrapper is changed to allow the usage of
virt-ssh-helper, this change force to use "netcat" (`nc`) by
appending to the migration URI: "&proxy=netcat"

[1] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=f8ec7c842d (rpc:
use new virt-ssh-helper binary for remote tunnelling, 2020-07-08)
[2] https://libvirt.org/git/?p=libvirt.git;a=commit;h=7d959c302d (rpc:
Fix virt-ssh-helper detection, 2020-10-27)

Closes-Bug: 1918250

Related: https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1926602

Change-Id: I3db9cd42aa63379ed6332ee77f67d1dfe4be8504
Co-Authored-By: David Vallee Delisle <dvd@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: Ide1f9484d0f9aaf719ccfbe3ab5282ecd901ae6b
(cherry picked from commit 697cbb83dbd538c7f51638f50531dac6a4b518c0)
(cherry picked from commit 287d26a5b4bbb13e88d8aae9afea718c5b7775aa)
(cherry picked from commit 43696fdbf64cc6817c45ed317914b4532699e54f)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated attributes from context

The oslo.context emits a warning for attributes that are not listed in
[1] and considered to be deprecated. According to the warning message,
the policy file should be modified to use $(project_id)s instead of
$(tenant_id)s. Also, context.user is deprecated. We should remove lines
using context.user and use context.user_id only.

The following deprecation warnings are gone with the patch:

- context.py:100: DeprecationWarning: Policy enforcement is depending on
  the value of tenant_id. This key is deprecated. Please update your
  policy file to use the standard policy values.

- test_auth.py:75: DeprecationWarning: Property â€˜userâ€™ has moved to
  â€˜user_idâ€™ in version â€˜2.6â€™ and will be removed in version â€˜3.0â€™

[1] https://github.com/openstack/oslo.context/blob/master/oslo_context/context.py#L313-L327

Change-Id: Ib06cd0d54772d17838789943b6a09c581b899435
Closes-Bug: #1976219

commit_message:
Nova: Use ssh transport for Ubuntu

Currently integration jobs in Ubuntu are broken because of an issue
with enabling libvirtd socket service.

The issue is caused by the policy in Ubuntu packaging that services
like libvirt or nova-compute are enabled by default.

Until we come up with the solution to workaround the issue, this change
switches migration transport from tcp to ssh.

Conflicts:
	manifests/nova.pp

Change-Id: I3b1839565f1f0ad80a9eb472d1040803ec574815
(cherry picked from commit 58a60f213e98c082e3baac1c5c2fa4f43e2d8fde)
(cherry picked from commit 44aa832194181cb425e845f037e4bf502ee5133c)
(cherry picked from commit 8faba63fcdc587f46b70750c7cb5a38be537fbfd)

commit_message:
Nova: Use ssh transport for Ubuntu

Currently integration jobs in Ubuntu are broken because of an issue
with enabling libvirtd socket service.

The issue is caused by the policy in Ubuntu packaging that services
like libvirt or nova-compute are enabled by default.

Until we come up with the solution to workaround the issue, this change
switches migration transport from tcp to ssh.

Change-Id: I3b1839565f1f0ad80a9eb472d1040803ec574815
(cherry picked from commit 58a60f213e98c082e3baac1c5c2fa4f43e2d8fde)
(cherry picked from commit 44aa832194181cb425e845f037e4bf502ee5133c)

commit_message:
Capture openstack resources as part of logs

This change ensures more openstack resources like services are captured
after tests, so that we can review status of deployment more in detail.

Change-Id: I1aef98da30b559d2e2e772e4f9601b09ff5f9238

commit_message:
Adding python3-dev and net-tools to install-packages.sh

Adding python3-dev for openstack cli. Adding net-tools for route.
As some environments do not have these packages installed, we are making
sure these are added by updating install-package.sh.

Change-Id: I95f26fdca3c9a8d8412831f44ba84051bb4b9c91

commit_message:
Set default python

Python needs to be set to python2 before checking for python3 to prevent
certain test framework errors.

Change-Id: Ifd1ed35160338688d3c723c055ca75cd999e46e0

Use lowercase hostname in DeployedServerPortMap

Lookups from the DeployedServerPortMap will always have
lowercase hostname.

commit_message:
Add ssl spec parameter to rgw

When tls-e is enabled, we need to make sure that the ssl keywork is
passed to the rgw spec. By passing this parameter (and setting it
to True), the tls mode for rgw is enabled, and the rgw_frontend_ssl
parameter is assimilated.

Change-Id: I92a35532e9a26a0f8d00660801ee8e8d5a329b8b
(cherry picked from commit 1e353efab254c8c5b0fad412d6fd352f8a4abf34)

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: Ide1f9484d0f9aaf719ccfbe3ab5282ecd901ae6b
(cherry picked from commit 697cbb83dbd538c7f51638f50531dac6a4b518c0)
'}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: Ide1f9484d0f9aaf719ccfbe3ab5282ecd901ae6b
(cherry picked from commit 697cbb83dbd538c7f51638f50531dac6a4b518c0)

commit_message:
Remove hardcoded undercloud baseos setting for c9

We have added discover-latest-image role(depends-on) in tqe to discover
latest Centos Stream 9 image. With this patch, Removing hardcoding
from release file for undercloud base setting for c9, We will use
the baseos info from discover-latest-image (tqe role)
to pull right base os for undercloud.

In this patch, scope is limited to use this new role in baremetal job.
We can extend the role for Centos 8 image discovery in
future but for now only using this for Centos9.(We have only
created baremetal job for C9 master for now and with c8 u/v on
eol path, c8 image discovery for train branch with no baremetal
job for train doesn't seems worth at this point.)

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart-extras/+/840433

commit_message:
Add role to discover Centos latest images

With this patch, we are adding a new role discover-latest-image to
discover the latest Centos Stream image, We are limiting the scope
for C9 for now, We can extend the role for Centos 8 image discovery
in future if there is a need.

Also, we are updating baremetal-prep-virthost.yml playbook to use
this new role for c9 case and in combination with patch[1] - we will
get rid of undercloud baseos hardcoding and use the latest discovered
image.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/+/838990/

Change-Id: I3a97edc63e96725a1690335f557508d56ed10258

commit_message:
Downgrade pacemaker and resource-agents

The patch downgrades:
pacemaker pacemaker-remote resource-agents
in container builds to avoid
errors at deployment step 5 with latest versions.

This patch also specifies the downgrade version.

Related-Bug: #1978997
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie5288864cd6f346a5bb5b481b4aa5dbd1abb9f47

commit_message:
[Collect-logs]Exclude git, tmp and unwanted rpm files.

We have started seeing a lot of POST_FAILURES while pushing
the logs to log server.

It might be related to huge amount of files getting pushed to
log server.
This patch adds new few more excludes to avoid pushing opendev
git files, /tmp and unwanted rpm files.

Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I8b80aee5dcda2d129bfb25a842cca11970a58423

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-24 01:24:48.000000000', 'message': 'Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: Ide1f9484d0f9aaf719ccfbe3ab5282ecd901ae6b
'}]
commit_message:
Ubuntu: Use utf8mb3 charset in MySQL

... to fix the broken idempotency in litmus job. Current mysql/mariadb
in Ubuntu replaces utf8 with uft8mb3 automatically and this behavior
results in unexpected change in second run.

Related-Bug: #1929073
Change-Id: Ide1f9484d0f9aaf719ccfbe3ab5282ecd901ae6b

commit_message:
CentOS 8: Fix wrong selinux type of /etc/rabbitmq

This is a temporal workaround for multiple selinux denials in CI and
fixes the wrong selinux type assigned to /etc/rabbitmq directory.

See https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=2056564 for details.

Change-Id: I3b8443327cc2bf75500dcf73be2ce549e51cc0d1

Change-Id: I0f7a0cf05c12f1746269fa4f827cd639a4fc347d
"}]
commit_message:
Create NRPE check to verify ceph daemons versions

This NRPE check confirms if the versions of cluster daemons are divergent.

WARN - any minor version diverged
WARN â€“ any versions are 1 release behind the mon
CRIT â€“ any versions are 2 releases behind the mon
CRIT â€“ any versions releases are head the mon

A juju action is also provided 'get-versions-report'
which provide to users, a quick way to see
daemons versions running on cluster hosts

Closes-Bug: #1943628
Change-Id: I0f7a0cf05c12f1746269fa4f827cd639a4fc347d

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-16 08:31:39.000000000', 'message': 'Only export overcloud for --stack-only/full deploy

Overcloud export contains stack outputs and passwords.
With ephemeral heat we save the stack outputs and
kill heat. We should export only when stack is created
to generate the configs and not when we run with
--setup-only/--config-download-only.

Also, stop using parsed_args.config_download which is
deprecated.

Change-Id: Ica73e4d04909352646b4518ccd93d01535a243db
(cherry picked from commit cbbe7cdd84768160acfaa32e19c8804e28aec380)
'}]
commit_message:
Only export overcloud for --stack-only/full deploy

Overcloud export contains stack outputs and passwords.
With ephemeral heat we save the stack outputs and
kill heat. We should export only when stack is created
to generate the configs and not when we run with
--setup-only/--config-download-only.

Also, stop using parsed_args.config_download which is
deprecated.

Change-Id: Ica73e4d04909352646b4518ccd93d01535a243db
(cherry picked from commit cbbe7cdd84768160acfaa32e19c8804e28aec380)

commit_message:
Adapt on puppet-rsyslog update

This patch switches rsyslog puppet class usage which is no longer
available since puppet-rsyslog v5.0.0 [1].

[1] voxpupuli/puppet-rsyslog#136

Change-Id: Ic53b78c06fc0b5a8a536d32fe33d7e621becd158

[{'created': '2022-06-28 00:54:29.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "project-config-grafana: add opendev-buildset-registry"

This reverts commit 900da9dddd282302a217f8b57b3c78a5d3d3ffc2.

This job calls use-buildset-registry which needs a registry running to
work.  We think this is basically as designed;
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I74c771d048c7a808511864445ed1a124644f661a
adds this to project-config.  Since we've decided this is a hard
dependency, revert this change.

Change-Id: Ice505b1f4e3e662989efdf3473886b767750ca4a
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "project-config-grafana: add opendev-buildset-registry"

This reverts commit 900da9dddd282302a217f8b57b3c78a5d3d3ffc2.

This job calls use-buildset-registry which needs a registry running to
work.  We think this is basically as designed;
https://review.opendev.org/#/q/I74c771d048c7a808511864445ed1a124644f661a
adds this to project-config.  Since we've decided this is a hard
dependency, revert this change.

Change-Id: Ice505b1f4e3e662989efdf3473886b767750ca4a

commit_message:
project-config-grafana: add opendev-buildset-registry

This job pulls through the registry, so we need to add this to start
the registry.  Since it's just doing screenshots for review
comparision it's only in check, so it's only added there.

Change-Id: I74c771d048c7a808511864445ed1a124644f661a

commit_message:
Add doc of Change Current VNF Package

This patch provides Tacker documents for change current vnf package
in V2-API. The specification about new API is added to API Reference.
Also, change current vnf package operation is added to
Tacker Use Cases Guide and CLI Reference.

This patch also adds change current vnf package restrictions to
error_handling user guide.

Implements: blueprint upgrade-vnf-package
Change-Id: I3f18bbab17c67e717dc0a9d36e92f812a40862e5

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-27 22:42:09.000000000', 'message': "project-config-grafana: make opendev-buildset-registry soft dep

This job was meant to work by either pulling through the registry for
speculative testing, or for project-config just running on released
images.  Make this soft so project-config doens't have to start a
registry.

Change-Id: Icd1b531de30a34780a340ea02209f49eb925de36
"}]
commit_message:
project-config-grafana: make opendev-buildset-registry soft dep

This job was meant to work by either pulling through the registry for
speculative testing, or for project-config just running on released
images.  Make this soft so project-config doens't have to start a
registry.

Change-Id: Icd1b531de30a34780a340ea02209f49eb925de36

the QoS policy, so the QoS min support can be dropped.

Change-Id: I216f84ed379d4554d5d9adee31f9af6f4d54ea94

commit_message:
NetApp ONTAP: Fix check QoS min support for SVM account

The SVM account has no access to the node name and it cannot create
the QoS policy, so the QoS min support can be dropped.

Includes the release note formatting fix from change I6544e5d68714.

Closes-Bug: #1924798
Change-Id: I216f84ed379d4554d5d9adee31f9af6f4d54ea94
(cherry picked from commit b7466f54f5a9dca1255d0f93017b260d808b42db)
(cherry picked from commit 4be091c42f9eaeda9df47d33beab8195fa333664)
(cherry picked from commit 4b719d99ff2d5b3bb3a1d964d83131ff2910d5b0)

instance and return screenshots to aid review.

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-23 21:33:40.000000000', 'message': 'Retire openstack-helm-deployments

As part of our discussion from the latest PTG, as well as several
prior, one of the goals for the project was to retire any of the
unused repositories under the openstack-helm umbrella.

This change seeks to retire the openstack-helm-deployments repo
since it has not been maintained and the use-case that it was
originally created for is no longer being actively pursued.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/+/847410
Change-Id: Idb63ff8e74427d2b2adab5f003441fb0f6b218b1
'}]
commit_message:
Retire openstack-helm-deployments

As part of our discussion from the latest PTG, as well as several
prior, one of the goals for the project was to retire any of the
unused repositories under the openstack-helm umbrella.

This change seeks to retire the openstack-helm-deployments repo
since it has not been maintained and the use-case that it was
originally created for is no longer being actively pursued.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/openstack-helm-deployments/+/847410
Change-Id: Idb63ff8e74427d2b2adab5f003441fb0f6b218b1

commit_message:
grafana : import and screenshot project-config graphs

This is a job that imports the graphs we have defined in
project-config/grafana to a testing grafana instance, then takes some
screenshots to validate the layout and aid review.

Operation is fairly straight-forward; a grafana container is setup
(see related work in Ibbc2b116d0c496655a7ce6bb6971e8270ac32647) and
grafyaml is used to import the dashboards from project-config.  We
query the grafana instance to find the dashboards, then use selenium
and a small helper to take screenshots of each.

It pulls graphyaml from the buildset registry as a soft dependency, so
we can also add it as an extra test to the grafyaml repo.

Change-Id: Ice0863d5a180738119d572df1871093a292126be

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-17 14:10:40.000000000', 'message': "[WIP/DNM] glance: create a dict to modify instead of modifying .Values

Before this change, doing the following:
1. helm install openstack ./openstack
1. helm upgrade openstack --reuse-values

resulted in the glance-api pod being recreated because its glance-etc
hash was changing. No differences were found in the glance-etc secret.

Seems related to modifying .Values via set. If instead a dictionary
is created representing .Values.conf.glance then there isn't a change
to the glance-etc hash.

Change-Id: I8bfb4154455a3a27bbc3a5cd354188d157a418fa
"}, {'created': '2022-06-22 16:00:41.000000000', 'message': "[WIP/DNM] glance: create a dict to modify instead of modifying .Values

1. helm upgrade openstack --reuse-values

resulted in the glance-api pod being recreated because its glance-etc

commit_message:
[WIP/DNM] glance: create a dict to modify instead of modifying .Values

Before this change, doing the following:
1. helm install openstack ./openstack
1. helm upgrade openstack --reuse-values

resulted in the glance-api pod being recreated because its glance-etc
hash was changing. No differences were found in the glance-etc secret.

Seems related to modifying .Values via set. If instead a dictionary
is created representing .Values.conf.glance then there isn't a change
to the glance-etc hash.

Change-Id: I8bfb4154455a3a27bbc3a5cd354188d157a418fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-27 14:24:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix manila plugin.sh set backend_availability_zone

Manila plugin is setting the availability zone of the
backends without checking if it is set. As result, a CI
configuring that field will not be respected.

Fixed by only setting the field in case its value was
not set before. Otherwise, keep as it is.

Change-Id: I546e5f057f3b748417dcbcfe9c3f3ae4a5d51556
'}]
commit_message:
Fix manila plugin.sh set backend_availability_zone

Manila plugin is setting the availability zone of the
backends without checking if it is set. As result, a CI
configuring that field will not be respected.

Fixed by only setting the field in case its value was
not set before. Otherwise, keep as it is.

Change-Id: I546e5f057f3b748417dcbcfe9c3f3ae4a5d51556

commit_message:
Fix ignored NovaLibvirtMaxQueues

The parameter was not properly added to RoleParametersValue. This fixes
that and ensures the parameter can be picked up to modify the parameter
in nova.conf.

Change-Id: Iab02048a147503020754ec5472f2630a4697c84e

commit_message:
As part of our use case, we are  building a CI pipeline with a vanilla Ubuntu 20.04 image for which python3-dev is a dependency for ./tools/deployment/common/setup-client and net-tools was needed for ./tools/deployment/developer/common/170-setup-gateway.sh. To address this we are requesting to add these packages. Please do the needful.

Change-Id: Ida684fb820e0614f76d785191876cef902ab0570

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-19 21:28:17.000000000', 'message': "Check if tripleo_admin_user exists before creating

Update the create_user tasks file in tripleo_create_admin
role to check if the user exists before calling the Ansible
user module. The module itself is supposed to be idempotent
but, as per the related bug, occasionaly failures occur
because the user already exists.

Also, set setype for files touched in the user's .ssh
directory because SELinux occasioinally prevents sshd
from read access on the authorized_keys file. Set the
correct setype explicitly instead of implicitly.

Related-Bug: #1917856
Change-Id: I3b02e0586a9dd76e2cf115723213641c90dfa420
"}, {'created': '2022-06-19 21:30:33.000000000', 'message': "Check if tripleo_admin_user exists before creating

Update the create_user tasks file in tripleo_create_admin
role to check if the user exists before calling the Ansible
user module. The module itself is supposed to be idempotent
but, as per the related bug, occasionaly failures occur
because the user already exists.

Also, set setype for files touched in the user's .ssh
directory because SELinux occasioinally prevents sshd
from read access on the authorized_keys file. Set the
correct setype explicitly instead of implicitly.

Related-Bug: #1979093
Change-Id: I3b02e0586a9dd76e2cf115723213641c90dfa420
"}]
commit_message:
Check if tripleo_admin_user exists before creating

Update the create_user tasks file in tripleo_create_admin
role to check if the user exists before calling the Ansible
user module. The module itself is supposed to be idempotent
but, as per the related bug, occasionaly failures occur
because the user already exists.

Also, set setype for files touched in the user's .ssh
directory because SELinux occasioinally prevents sshd
from read access on the authorized_keys file. Set the
correct setype explicitly instead of implicitly.

Related-Bug: #1979093
Change-Id: I3b02e0586a9dd76e2cf115723213641c90dfa420

commit_message:
Use Octavia's own default user_log_format value

The HAProxy tenant flow logs are showing "[ssl_c_s_dn]" instead of
the client certificate DN string because of a bug in the default
value in THT. By using Octavia's own default we avoid this.

Conflicts:
	deployment/octavia/octavia-base.yaml

Change-Id: Ice012188654cfef7ebdb95630015b656d6fa0032
(cherry picked from commit 7acb4f490abd1ad58cf6850d6c301322f96cf31a)

commit_message:
Add support for MultiStrOpt

This replaces the provider implementation of keystone_config type so
that MultiStrOpt, which is used by several options like
 - oslo_messaging_notifications/driver
 - oslo_policy/policy_dirs
are handled correctly.

Change-Id: I84bb99e1ad746611d31f2e950614be73de4e8f0e
(cherry picked from commit 2b7a15eb91f4a5cf58f82b1fecaba6d9eece422a)

[{'created': '2022-06-26 09:16:34.000000000', 'message': 'Introduce a new class to delete the default libvirt network

libvirt by default enables the default network so that it can provide
dhcp for all virtual machines running on that host. However this is not
required in OpenStack deployments and should be removed.

This change introduces a new class to purge the delete network.

commit_message:
Introduce a new class to disable the default libvirt network

libvirt by default enables the default network so that it can provide
dhcp for all virtual machines running on that host. However this is not
required in OpenStack deployments and should be removed.

This change introduces a new class to disable the delete network.

Change-Id: Ibc0801694770913d494aa260161fa406689436ad

commit_message:
New dedicated user for Galera SST synchronization

When the Galera is configured to use mariabackup, the
synchronization takes place by connecting to the
database with configuratble user credentials.
Generate a random password for this use case.

Related-Bug: #1973872

Change-Id: I1509bd30fbd253790b17e04ef15dca6c58de7311

commit_message:
Add CephRbdTrashSchedulerEnable boolean

This patch introduces a boolean used to enable the trash purge
schedule interval on the cinder related pools.

Depends-On: I9b368da796ed6b3ccba13dc9430edb6bca8f91ea
Change-Id: If376539f2ae7d6462de9121729da90769a783041

commit_message:
Use already available ansible inventory

Ie02259336c763cfa980b59ad64f9e478d05690fb dropped
the script which is used everywhere.

Conflicts:
	tasks/common/validation_group_run.yaml

Resolved conflict caused by b9c5180034453ed771d751ad46bb089b7cd5e4d7 .
Because we are getting rid of the inventory script, we do not need that
change while backporthig this.

Closes-Bug: #1979707
Change-Id: I55e29ba86a847a14a363c224055885bfd086fbb6
(cherry picked from commit 1ae04110e0cba69a95a7441287f1cd8587b46771)

commit_message:
Compute grafana_vip using net_vip_map instead of hiera

This change fixes the way the grafana vip is computed: now it
uses the existing net_vip_map instead of running hiera commands
on the undercloud.

Change-Id: Ibad723edaa2de9ffad896d8f85ca9b5c09aa0678
(cherry picked from commit 5a8c23c64e70f60dc87b12991f3f0f1dbbd025ef)

commit_message:
Fix typo in parameter name

This change fixes typo in parameter name from
`dnspython_pakage_name` to `dnspython_package_name`.

The tests were using correct parameter name but in manifests
incorrect name was used.

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-01 01:21:26.000000000', 'message': 'Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

'}]
commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I136f7d9222d5665127252329e7add27297c0a05e

messages: [{'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2022-05-16 11:47:46.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2022-06-27 14:49:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-16 11:47:46.000000000', 'message': "volume: Correct output of 'volume attachment create'

When adding these, we missed that the underlying cinder library call
actually returns a dictionary and not a Resource-based object. This
requires slightly different handling. Fix this.

Change-Id: Ie065fe4198ae1238830cb619220e856390d4cb6e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>
"}]
commit_message:
volume: Correct output of 'volume attachment create'

When adding these, we missed that the underlying cinder library call
actually returns a dictionary and not a Resource-based object. This
requires slightly different handling. Fix this.

Change-Id: Ie065fe4198ae1238830cb619220e856390d4cb6e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

subject: Don't show tenant_id in network objects
messages: [{'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2022-06-27 08:53:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2022-06-27 14:43:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-27 08:53:45.000000000', 'message': "Don't show tenant_id in network objects

Patch [0] dropped mapping the tenant_id attribute to project_id.
However, the Neutron API still returns the tenant_id attribute in
addition to the project_id and so we still need to discard it from
the output.

[0] I5f62f2a76592eaaaed6703624e959df41a6ecc8f

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Iba1e003bf587802f28928cb44d160b3b3fb1f840
"}]
commit_message:
Don't show tenant_id in network objects

Patch [0] dropped mapping the tenant_id attribute to project_id.
However, the Neutron API still returns the tenant_id attribute in
addition to the project_id and so we still need to discard it from
the output.

[0] I5f62f2a76592eaaaed6703624e959df41a6ecc8f

Signed-off-by: Dr. Jens Harbott <harbott@osism.tech>
Change-Id: Iba1e003bf587802f28928cb44d160b3b3fb1f840

commit_message:

test class they were hidden in in the process.

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27900, 'date': '2022-06-27 14:31:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-05-30 13:06:46.000000000', 'message': 'Warn when no statsd library available

When statsd python library is not available and metrics emiting is
enabled SDK will silently skip metrics. This can lead to frustration
trying to explain absence of metrics. Throw a warning when statsd host
is set but lib is not available.

Change-Id: I30f48bb43814d13af929976393a3b85d27568123
'}]
commit_message:
Warn when no statsd library available

When statsd python library is not available and metrics emiting is
enabled SDK will silently skip metrics. This can lead to frustration
trying to explain absence of metrics. Throw a warning when statsd host
is set but lib is not available.

Change-Id: I30f48bb43814d13af929976393a3b85d27568123

commit_message:
Fix the outdated links in metadata

- Now the project is hosted under the openstack org

- The project page and issues are now found in launchpad

- opendev git should be used instead of github, which is a mirror now.

Change-Id: Id267c9814621e26e53cfd035d8e9b79d16c56584

commit_message:
Modify the url of OVN tutorial

Original url leads user to a markdown file, I think it's better to
use official html document rather than a markdown file.

Change-Id: Ib3ee4c6bccbb98a6469e2d7e9cde652288bbb163

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-23 13:19:33.000000000', 'message': 'Filter the ports by VNIC type

In ``check_baremetal_ports_dhcp_options``, the ports need to be
retrieved based on the VNIC type. The VNIC type is stored in
"ml2_port_bindings" table, not "ports" table.  Because the ML2Plugin
``get_ports`` method can filter only by "ports" database register
fields, it is needed to retrieve those ports using a custom database
query and then use the plugin method to retrieve the ports, converted
to dictionaries and the extensions processed.

Closes-Bug: #1979643
Change-Id: Iab227d9de75e4b1b927043ce27bdc346066478e8
'}]
commit_message:
Filter the ports by VNIC type

In ``check_baremetal_ports_dhcp_options``, the ports need to be
retrieved based on the VNIC type. The VNIC type is stored in
"ml2_port_bindings" table, not "ports" table.  Because the ML2Plugin
``get_ports`` method can filter only by "ports" database register
fields, it is needed to retrieve those ports using a custom database
query and then use the plugin method to retrieve the ports, converted
to dictionaries and the extensions processed.

Closes-Bug: #1979643
Change-Id: Iab227d9de75e4b1b927043ce27bdc346066478e8

commit_message:
Fix CI jobs

- removing l-c job from CI testing (just to unblock the gate)
- move grenade job to bios and increase grenade_test_timeout
- increase the vm disk for testing to 6Gb

Change-Id: I454ccc5a4648264b8af667f4ea58cdcdac5b72e6

Add the tripleo_ssh_known_hosts role to the OpenStack config playbook.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>

Let's do this in deploy steps - because we don't control
when e.g. OVN 21.09 gets updated to 21.12 in images.

[1]: https://docs.ovn.org/en/latest/intro/install/ovn-upgrades.html#upgrade-ovn-controller

Closes-Bug: #1979329
Change-Id: Iea3f9e844741f44a17852f0213db73e67203beb4
"}]
commit_message:
ovn: deploy/upgrade ovn-controller first

According to [1] ovn-controller should be upgraded first.
Let's do this in deploy steps - because we don't control
when e.g. OVN 21.09 gets updated to 21.12 in images.

[1]: https://docs.ovn.org/en/latest/intro/install/ovn-upgrades.html#upgrade-ovn-controller

Closes-Bug: #1979329
Change-Id: Iea3f9e844741f44a17852f0213db73e67203beb4

'}]
commit_message:
Replace deprecated assertRaisesRegexp

It was deprecated in favor of assertRaisesRegex added in Python 3.2.
We can replace it now because Python 2 is no longer supported.

Change-Id: I4cec6e44d48bcee9808bfd647f3a45cd8b1e2f11

commit_message:
Switch back to legacy facts

Facter 4 requires dotted-style access to read facts in nested keys.
(facts['os.family'] instead of facts['os']['family']).

This change replaces modern facts by legacy top-level facts, because
legacy facts can be accessed by the consistent manner.

Change-Id: I14bee624d8780cebd07cbf44f08008c35fb5c562

commit_message:
Update potential triggers to consider dropping of the project

Recently we discussed with Release Management team some possible
improvements in the project governance. Summary of that discussion can
be found in [1].
This patch updates potential triggers to consider project to be dropped
in the dropping-projects document to reflect those improvements
mentioned in [1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2022-May/028418.html

Change-Id: I3c9bb37be8ab9ab5282377169de906db2bf5b7fc

commit_message:
[docs] add tox, zuul maintenance tasks

Explain what configuration changes need to be made during
the trailing phase of cinderlib development, when cinderlib
master is still the development branch of the previous release
cycle.

Change-Id: I8c56b1ee15dfdb71d82ea856729b3ebe65029bbe

[{'created': '2022-06-13 16:43:22.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Add local upper constraints support

- Add a new tox environment, generate-local-uc, to generate a local
constraints file suitable for cinderlib
- Add command_pre (where appropriate) to make sure the local u-c file is
up to date before running tests
- Add supporting tools/* files for local constraints generation and
validation
- Change testenvs (where appropriate) to use the local u-c file (can be
overridden as usual via the TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE environment variable)
- Make changes to other testenvs so that all are using the appropriate
constraints in the install_command

TODO: figure out zuul support

Change-Id: I8cb4085dd465043a783c974886f56e49820871a1
'}, {'created': '2022-06-13 20:44:34.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add local upper constraints support

The issue is that we want to install os-brick from source, but if we
do this using upper-constraints on the install, it will fail.  This
patch modifies the tox install command used by appropriate testenvs
so it will create and use a local constraints file with os-brick
removed.

The local u-c file is named 'local-upper-constraints.txt'.  The
constraints file used can be overridden as usual via the
TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE environment variable.

Change-Id: I8cb4085dd465043a783c974886f56e49820871a1

commit_message:
Add local upper constraints support

The issue is that we want to install os-brick from source, but if we
do this using upper-constraints on the install, it will fail.  This
patch modifies the tox install command used by appropriate testenvs
so it will create and use a local constraints file with os-brick
removed.

The local u-c file is named 'local-upper-constraints.txt'.  The
constraints file used can be overridden via the
CINDERLIB_CONSTRAINTS_FILE environment variable.

Change-Id: I8cb4085dd465043a783c974886f56e49820871a1

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-22 13:07:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix privsep issues inside virtual env

When a virtual environment is created with the "--system-site-packages"
option and privsep is installed on the system privsep will only use the
system packages and completely ignore the ones in the virtual
environment.

This results in errors such as the ones we see:

- In the Ussuri gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.rootwrap'

- In the Wallaby gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.nvmeof'

This happens because os-brick and cinder are starting privsep using the
"privsep-helper" mechanism, and privsep was not installed in the virtual
env because it was already present system wide, so the "privsep-helper"
that is executed is the one from "/usr/local/bin/privsep-helper".

This python script "privsep-helper" ignores the virtual environment and
forces usage of the system's python, for example in a Wallaby
installation this could be "#!/usr/bin/python3.6".

Since it ignores the virtual environment it won't use its packages and
anything that's not present on system wide will not be found, and if
found it may be executing different code.

This patch fixes this issue by replacing the helper used to start
privsep with our own command.

This command is the same as the one usually installed in /usr/local/bin
but using /usr/bin/env to select the python to use.

This new script has been included as data in the cinderlib namespace
instead of making it install as a system script (like the original
privsep command) because we don't want to polute the system wide
binaries directory just for a corner case.

Change-Id: I0278b42785d14f92a521e6deff872dcba6505270
Related-Bug: #1958159
Closes-Bug: #1979534

Closes-Bug: #1979534

commit_message:
Fix privsep issues inside virtual env

When a virtual environment is created with the "--system-site-packages"
option and privsep is installed on the system privsep will only use the
system packages and completely ignore the ones in the virtual
environment.

This results in errors such as the ones we see:

- In the Ussuri gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.rootwrap'

- In the Wallaby gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.nvmeof'

This happens because os-brick and cinder are starting privsep using the
"privsep-helper" mechanism, and privsep was not installed in the virtual
env because it was already present system wide, so the "privsep-helper"
that is executed is the one from "/usr/local/bin/privsep-helper".

This python script "privsep-helper" ignores the virtual environment and
forces usage of the system's python, for example in a Wallaby
installation this could be "#!/usr/bin/python3.6".

Since it ignores the virtual environment it won't use its packages and
anything that's not present on system wide will not be found, and if
found it may be executing different code.

This patch fixes this issue by replacing the helper used to start
privsep with our own command.

This command is the same as the one usually installed in /usr/local/bin
but using /usr/bin/env to select the python to use.

This new script has been included as data in the cinderlib namespace
instead of making it install as a system script (like the original
privsep command) because we don't want to polute the system wide
binaries directory just for a corner case.

We also need to preserve user site-packages for the running Python when
calling root from the virtual environment, since the packages installed
on the virtual environment with "--system-site-packages" would have
taken those into consideration during the installation and not the ones
present on the root user.

To help debug issues at the gate all functional tests are now running
with debug logs.

Change-Id: I0278b42785d14f92a521e6deff872dcba6505270
Related-Bug: #1958159
Closes-Bug: #1979534

commit_message:
Improves support for Elasticsearch storage.

Requires Elasticsearch 7. Provides an index template to manage
cloudkitty document mappings with the option to include user
provided component templates. Uses dated indices and an index
alias to allow for better management of data.

Change-Id: Ie7301ebccc3a72876abcb5c4cc8c07ceaaa29e29

subject: Fix privsep issues inside virtual env
messages:
[{'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2022-06-24 21:48:29.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2022-06-24 22:50:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 10459, 'date': '2022-06-27 10:39:57.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9535, 'date': '2022-06-27 11:08:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2022-06-27 12:20:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-24 21:48:29.000000000', 'message': 'Fix privsep issues inside virtual env

When a virtual environment is created with the "--system-site-packages"
option and privsep is installed on the system privsep will only use the
system packages and completely ignore the ones in the virtual
environment.

This results in errors such as the ones we see:

- In the Ussuri gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.rootwrap'

- In the Wallaby gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.nvmeof'

This happens because os-brick and cinder are starting privsep using the
"privsep-helper" mechanism, and privsep was not installed in the virtual
env because it was already present system wide, so the "privsep-helper"
that is executed is the one from "/usr/local/bin/privsep-helper".

This python script "privsep-helper" ignores the virtual environment and
forces usage of the system's python, for example in a Wallaby
installation this could be "#!/usr/bin/python3.6".

Since it ignores the virtual environment it won't use its packages and
anything that's not present on system wide will not be found, and if
found it may be executing different code.

This patch fixes this issue by replacing the helper used to start
privsep with our own command.

This command is the same as the one usually installed in /usr/local/bin
but using /usr/bin/env to select the python to use.

This new script has been included as data in the cinderlib namespace
instead of making it install as a system script (like the original
privsep command) because we don't want to polute the system wide
binaries directory just for a corner case.

We also need to preserve user site-packages for the running Python when
calling root from the virtual environment, since the packages installed
on the virtual environment with "--system-site-packages" would have
taken those into consideration during the installation and not the ones
present on the root user.

To help debug issues at the gate all functional tests are now running
with debug logs.

Change-Id: I0278b42785d14f92a521e6deff872dcba6505270
Related-Bug: #1958159
Closes-Bug: #1979534
(cherry picked from commit 4d784d23a91f789918929ca397910f3121fa166e)
(cherry picked from commit 4fc56c815b0e9e4d3706dca14bbe54fbb4866272)

  'os_brick.privileged.rootwrap'

- In the Wallaby gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named

"privsep-helper" mechanism, and privsep was not installed in the virtual
env because it was already present system wide, so the "privsep-helper"
that is executed is the one from "/usr/local/bin/privsep-helper".

This python script "privsep-helper" ignores the virtual environment and
forces usage of the system's python, for example in a Wallaby

Since it ignores the virtual environment it won't use its packages and

This patch fixes this issue by replacing the helper used to start
privsep with our own command.

This command is the same as the one usually installed in /usr/local/bin
but using /usr/bin/env to select the python to use.

This new script has been included as data in the cinderlib namespace

We also need to preserve user site-packages for the running Python when

(cherry picked from commit 4d784d23a91f789918929ca397910f3121fa166e)

commit_message:
Fix privsep issues inside virtual env

When a virtual environment is created with the "--system-site-packages"
option and privsep is installed on the system privsep will only use the
system packages and completely ignore the ones in the virtual
environment.

This results in errors such as the ones we see:

- In the Ussuri gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.rootwrap'

- In the Wallaby gate: ModuleNotFoundError: No module named
  'os_brick.privileged.nvmeof'

This happens because os-brick and cinder are starting privsep using the
"privsep-helper" mechanism, and privsep was not installed in the virtual
env because it was already present system wide, so the "privsep-helper"
that is executed is the one from "/usr/local/bin/privsep-helper".

This python script "privsep-helper" ignores the virtual environment and
forces usage of the system's python, for example in a Wallaby
installation this could be "#!/usr/bin/python3.6".

Since it ignores the virtual environment it won't use its packages and
anything that's not present on system wide will not be found, and if
found it may be executing different code.

This patch fixes this issue by replacing the helper used to start
privsep with our own command.

This command is the same as the one usually installed in /usr/local/bin
but using /usr/bin/env to select the python to use.

This new script has been included as data in the cinderlib namespace
instead of making it install as a system script (like the original
privsep command) because we don't want to polute the system wide
binaries directory just for a corner case.

We also need to preserve user site-packages for the running Python when
calling root from the virtual environment, since the packages installed
on the virtual environment with "--system-site-packages" would have
taken those into consideration during the installation and not the ones
present on the root user.

To help debug issues at the gate all functional tests are now running
with debug logs.

Change-Id: I0278b42785d14f92a521e6deff872dcba6505270
Related-Bug: #1958159
Closes-Bug: #1979534
(cherry picked from commit 4d784d23a91f789918929ca397910f3121fa166e)
(cherry picked from commit 4fc56c815b0e9e4d3706dca14bbe54fbb4866272)

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* rebuild for reactive charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* add run-on base for 22.10
* drop series from metadata.yaml in favor of run-on bases

Change-Id: I6ad48d26e22f3298f0181a7d3644be77357357ff

commit_message:
Make publish_collection more universal

With this change we replace zuul.projects with zuul.project that will
imply any project which will run the job. Also we read galaxy.yml as
vars file to predict packed collection naming for futher upload.

Change-Id: I66e27f3026689ad719384203fe66d65f5bca46ce
Needed-By: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-config_template/+/846391
(cherry picked from commit 8f27184f30df50f169b72e6043c8fcc7e5cc1d00)

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-10-14 08:05:44.000000000', 'message': "Allow different allocation ratio scenarios

Allocation ratios can be set via nova config, host aggregate metadata or
through the placement API [1].

Previously the os_nova role would always template a nova.conf value for
cpu/ram/disk allocation ratios which forces a deployer to use the nova config
allocation ratio scenario. The nova config code expects a float type for these
ratios, and uses the default python value None when they are not defined [2].

It is not possible to pass the python value None through the config file, so
this patch detects the special case of the nova_cpu/ram/disk/_allocation_ratio
variables being set to the string 'None' and excludes them from the config file.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/ussuri/admin/configuration/schedulers.html#usage-scenarios
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a4068802ef2eca5568a58b8f961a521a3a3ddcb5/nova/conf/compute.py#L422

Change-Id: If464171d6b0ef22d14c4aaa6eb23e0947cf774d9
"}, {'created': '2020-10-18 07:59:20.000000000', 'message': 'Allow different allocation ratio scenarios

Allocation ratios can be set via nova config, host aggregate metadata or
through the placement API [1].

Previously the os_nova role would always template a nova.conf value for
cpu/ram/disk allocation ratios which forces a deployer to use the nova
config allocation ratio scenario. The nova config code expects a float
type for these ratios, and uses the default python value None when they
are not defined [2].

It is not possible to pass the python value None through the config
file, so this patch detects the special case of the
nova_cpu/ram/disk/_allocation_ratio variables being set to an empty
string and excludes them from the config file.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/ussuri/admin/configuration/schedulers.html#usage-scenarios
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a4068802ef2eca5568a58b8f961a521a3a3ddcb5/nova/conf/compute.py#L422

Change-Id: If464171d6b0ef22d14c4aaa6eb23e0947cf774d9
'}]
commit_message:
Allow different allocation ratio scenarios

Allocation ratios can be set via nova config, host aggregate metadata or
through the placement API [1].

Previously the os_nova role would always template a nova.conf value for
cpu/ram/disk allocation ratios which forces a deployer to use the nova
config allocation ratio scenario. The nova config code expects a float
type for these ratios, and uses the default python value None when they
are not defined [2].

It is not possible to pass the python value None through the config
file, so this patch detects the special case of the
nova_cpu/ram/disk/_allocation_ratio variables being set to an empty
string and excludes them from the config file.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/nova/ussuri/admin/configuration/schedulers.html#usage-scenarios
[2] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/a4068802ef2eca5568a58b8f961a521a3a3ddcb5/nova/conf/compute.py#L422

Change-Id: If464171d6b0ef22d14c4aaa6eb23e0947cf774d9

commit_message:
Warn when smartctl not found

Currently, if smartctl is not found by IPA, it will silently skip ATA
secure erase and proceed to shred (if enabled). This is supposedly for
backwards compatibility, but is quite hard to diagnose.

This change adds a warning message to make it more obvious what is
happening.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I03a381e99de79f201ec7e9a388777c3d48457e93

commit_message:
Drop lower-constraints.txt and its testing

As discussed in TC PTG[1] and TC resolution[2], we are
dropping the lower-constraints.txt file and its testing.
We will keep lower bounds in the requirements.txt file but
with a note that these are not tested lower bounds and we
try our best to keep them updated.

[1] https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/tc-zed-ptg#L326
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/resolutions/20220414-drop-lower-constraints.html#proposal

Change-Id: I817e5112eb57df2e6192d3cfa681b7768832c77a

subject: Improve string representation of DB models
messages: [{'account_id': 34429, 'date': '2022-06-27 08:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 34429, 'date': '2022-06-27 11:37:49.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nnot backporting to ussuri'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-06-27 08:38:18.000000000', 'message': 'Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131

Change-Id: I4c218793948b0ed7ce0c143d6c794516fdeb224f
(cherry picked from commit ff6d0c5280fbdbe8f5361469fb88448fa650f365)
(cherry picked from commit bc95e34819bed67444c752e59c01a90c0c6df89b)
(cherry picked from commit 77c86a2409a7e244c713a6d680d2d38f9f6e7bbd)
(cherry picked from commit b55247d1feaa99b7b383a0a41e1685b57a547678)
(cherry picked from commit a57c0221b4ef29aa30be816503335949f7461dcf)
'}]
commit_message:
Improve string representation of DB models

This replaces the default "<XYClass object at 0xdeadbeeff00>"
repr() for DB objects, which is pretty useless.
This change makes it easier to identify DB objects in debuggers
(and logs, if objects get logged).

__repr__() and __str__() have slightly different purposes.

The purpose of __repr__() is to return a string that uniquely identifies
a single object. __str__(), on the other hand, should produce a human
readable string. Another thing that is worth to note is that str() will
call __repr__() if __str__() is not implemented, repr() will always call
__repr__(). More details can be found under [1].

By implementing a generic __repr__() in the base class
there should be no need to override it in the models classes.
However, one might not be interested in seeing all
the object's attributes in a string representation
(which is what the generic __repr__() would do) or
certain sensitive information should be hidden from users.
In those cases it makes sense to implement __str__() for certain
classes specifically.

[1]: https://stackoverflow.com/a/2626364/6265131

Change-Id: I4c218793948b0ed7ce0c143d6c794516fdeb224f
(cherry picked from commit ff6d0c5280fbdbe8f5361469fb88448fa650f365)
(cherry picked from commit bc95e34819bed67444c752e59c01a90c0c6df89b)
(cherry picked from commit 77c86a2409a7e244c713a6d680d2d38f9f6e7bbd)
(cherry picked from commit b55247d1feaa99b7b383a0a41e1685b57a547678)
(cherry picked from commit a57c0221b4ef29aa30be816503335949f7461dcf)

commit_message:
Replace elastic-recheck section with OpenSearch

The elastic-recheck service was taken offline when the old Logstash
system ceased operation. For now, link to information about the new
OpenSearch cluster instead, until such time as elastic-recheck is
resurrected based on that replacement backend.

Change-Id: I4e29c2ecb5f5b86462306be563bc81214cabf7de

In general this is ok, but there are cases where it can be problematic
for example if we have a deadlock situation or if a lock takes a very

Change-Id: Ida70e9b6098b2e0426cc479811e08a164ed24899
